title: Ticket #6838: Improve JobEvent (Python) API - Python 3 idioms
description: Ticket #6814 added Python 2.7 container-type methods to JobEvent. These methods work in Python 3, but the idiomatic interface is different. Primarily, Python 3.7 removes the iter*() methods but changes keys(), values(), and items() to return 'view objects'. While leaving the iter*() methods in should be harmless, we should see if it's possible to implement 'view objects' in such a way that they're also compatible with the return type in the Python 2.7 API.
creator: tlmiller
